result.execSummary:
The defendant Cedric A Ivory was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: To case 14CF1325, consecutive to any other time with credit for 55 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain part time employment.
Participate in vocational training program.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions; Firearm possession and Voting.

No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).
No new law violations rising to the level of probable.
No contact with victim Rodney U. or A.J. Ugent Fur Inc. located at 8333 W. Capitol Dr.

Take any prescription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by probation agent.
Participate in Cognitive thinking.

Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.
Cooperate with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders restitution in the stipulated amount of $1,895.00 payable to Rodney U. - bail to apply from this case and 14CF1325. Defense requests restitution hearing as to disputed amount. The Court orders balance of bail held pending restitution hearing. The Court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.


**01-22-15/ William W. Brash**
The Court ordered the defendant to pay an ADDITIONAL $300.00 in restitution, bringing restitution total to $2195.00 ($1,895.00 + $300.00), payable to Rodney U.    Bail to apply from this case and from 14CF1325.   
The Court orders any unpaid balance to be paid through collection by the DOC, from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.     Failure to pay results in a civil judgment

Pay all supervision fees.
Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs - bail to apply only after restitution paid in full from bail.

Attorney James Edgar Toran appears telephonically, defendant Cedric A Ivory not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Restitution hearing.  The parties inform the Court that an agreement has been reached as to stipulation.  The state sets forth said agreement.  Based upon stipulation of the parties the Court orders an additional $300.00 in restitution bringing restitution total to $2195.00 payable to Rodney U.- bail to apply from this case and 14CF1325.  If any balance the Court ordered restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any balance due and owing to convert to civil judgment.
Matter calendared for Restitution Hearing.  Branch 21 in jury trial on today.  Restitution Hearing continued to 1-2-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 11/26/2014 received and filed. ( 34 Pages)
Justice Point DISCHARGE SUMMARY Report, received and filed.
On request of defense Sentencing hearing set for 11-04-14 RESCHEDULED to 11-26-14 at 8:30 a.m.

14RM048777  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
10-22-2014
with Attorney James Toran.  Sentencing Hearing scheduled for 11-04-14 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 21.

Defendant Cedric A Ivory in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Cedric A Ivory in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing.  Hearing proceeded.  Statement made by the state.   Attorney Toran instructed to return to Branch 17 at this time for jury question.  Due to the lateness of the hour (4:35 p.m.) the Court to adjourn this hearing.

TURN OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and ALL OTHER PREVIOUSLY ORDERED BAIL CONDITIONS REMAIN.

*$800.00 on deposit/defendant MUST post $200.00 CASH*

Defendant Cedric A Ivory not in court, defendant in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

*THIS ENTRY IS ENTENDED TO CORRECT COURT ORDER AMENDING CASH BAIL ON 10-14-16*

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing on today.  Attorney Toran NOT PRESENT, in jury trial before Branch 17.  The Court calls this matter on the record to make a CORRECTION as to bail order made on 10-14-14.  The Court ordered the bail increased by $200.00; and orders cash bail of $750.00 CASH with same conditions.   The Court was in error by indicating that the current bail amount was $550.00.  The current bail amount was actually increased to $800.00 on 6-09-14.  The Court's intention was to raise the bail by $200.00 therefore the Court orders cash bail set at $1,000.00 with all other conditions remaining.
All bail previously posted remains on deposit. Defendant to post an additional $200.00 CASH.  All other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Cedric A Ivory in court.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel is in trial and unable to appear in court, appears briefly by telephone. Court addresses Justice Point violations. Court orders bench warrant withdrawn.  Court addresses bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court.  Benjamin Lindsay, appearing for Jeremy R. Arn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Parties in court to address violation report received.  Statements to the Court.  Defense counsel requests stayed bench warrant.
  
Due to violation report received, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  Court will address forfeiture of bail on the next court date.  Case remains scheduled for sentencing in Branch 21 on 10-14-2014.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Cedric A Ivory in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing on today.  Defense motion for adjournment heard and granted by the court; no objection from the state.  The Court indicates that this will be the last adjournment granted for defense.  New date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cedric A Ivory in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Case scheduled for Sentencing Hearing on 9-16-14 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 21.

The Court requests additional information from JusticePoint regarding drug testing process.  Case passed to facilitated appearance of JusticePoint worker.  Case recalled.  Tiffany Thompson and Elise Josephson appears from JusticePoint.  Statements made by Tiffany Thompson.  Further argument of the state and defense heard.  On state's motion, the Court ordered bail increased by $250.00 CASH (in each case) with same bail conditions as previously ordered.  Case remains set for Plea Hearing on 6-23-14 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 21.

Oral motion for substitution of attorney heard and granted by the court; no objection from the state.
Bail posted on 2-24-14 remains on deposit, defendant must post an additional $250.00.

CASE RECALLED.......
Defendant Cedric A Ivory in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Case recalled upon appearance of the defendant.  Bail argument of the parties heard.  The Court orders warrant withdrawn at this time (not printed as of yet).  On motion of the state, the Court orders bail increased by $250.00 CASH with same conditions as previously ordered.

Attorney Christian T Eichenlaub in court.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing hearing on today.  Defendant not present.  Defense informs the court that the defendant was recently involved in a car accident and is also seeking to retain private counsel (Atty. James Toran).  Statement by the state.  On motion of the state, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Bail not forfeited at this time.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case called on the record to address JusticePoint violation report as to the defendant's case other case (14CF1325).  No action taken in this matter.  Case remains set for Plea and sentencing on 6-04-14 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AJ Ugent Furs Inc., Robert U., Store Owner and Lori N., Store Associate.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.

Defendant Cedric A Ivory in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for scheduling conference, Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
